Important Notice

January 2018

  • 1/6Protecting Azure’s Clients from the Threat of CPU Security Vulnerabilities

    An update to repair a CPU hardware-based security vulnerability of extensive impact that has been completely deployed in all regions across China. The Azure infrastructure has been updated on the virtualization engine level this time. We advise you to continue to use best security practices when it comes to virtual machine imaging. Maintaining the security of our users is always our primary mission. Thank you very much for your understanding and cooperation during this update!

    For more information, please visit Azure’s blog articles.

Product Update

Expand All

January 2018

  • 1/31Azure Network Monitoring Program Officially Released

    Monitoring and diagnosis of your cloud Azure network can be simplified by the application of Azure network monitoring programs (Network Watcher). By using the diagnostics and visualization tools in the Network Watcher, you can:

    • Capture remote data packets in the virtual machines;
    • Use a traffic log to learn about network traffic;
    • Carry out diagnosis on the Azure VPN gateway and connection.

    This service is comprised of data packet capture, connection troubleshooting, next hop address, IP stream verification, security group view and network security group (NSG) traffic log.

    For details on pricing, please visit the Detailed Pricing of the Network Monitoring Program web page. For more information on this service and how this service is deployed, please visit the Network Monitoring Program’s Service Functions and Network Monitoring Program Documents web pages.

  • 1/31Azure API Management Public Preview Version Officially Released

    We are pleased to announce that a public preview version of Azure API Management has now been launched in China. Azure API Management is a suite of full life-cycle solutions released to both external and internal clients. The clients will use API Management to rapidly create a consistent, modern API gateway for existing back-end services hosted in any locations, help clients prevent abuse and overuse, as well as gain an in-depth understanding of usage and operation.

    The major application scenarios of Azure API Management include:

    • A digital conversion is realized through external and internal usage of API with both efficiency and flexibility;
    • Increase market share through provision of existing services and data to partners and the public;
    • Attract clients by displaying key systems to the secure application of mobile and web applications, as well as by authentication, ratio limit and quota protection.

    In response to client feedback, we will introduce three important updates to API Management starting March 1, 2018:

    • Replace the daily charge with an hourly charge to make API Management more accessible and more cost-effective. All existing users will automatically start on the hourly charge model beginning March 1, 2018;
    • Introduce a basic pricing layer in addition to development, standard and advanced pricing layers;
    • The original standard pricing layer will include Azure AD (Azure Active Directory).

    For details on pricing, please visit the Detailed Pricing of API Management web page. For more information on this service and how this service is deployed, please visit the API Management’s Service Functions and API Management Documentation web pages. For more information about this release, please refer to posts on the Release of Azure API Management Preview Version Blog.

  • 1/15Notice about R Server Virtual Machine Being Renamed as the Machine Learning Server

    R Server is an enterprise-level server to host and manage the parallel and distributed work load of the R process in servers (Linux and Windows) and clusters (Hadoop and Apache Spark). It provides solutions structured by using R software with execution engines, expands open-source R, supports high-performance analysis, statistical analysis, machine learning scenarios and large-scale data sets.

    This renaming is reflected in the fact that Python is a new advanced analysis language. R Server virtual machines in the existing Azure can be used continuously within a limited period of time. If you obtained your R Server virtual machine through the Azure website, you can continue to visit existing R Server products. As it is only a name change at this time, using the existing application developed for the R Server in the Machine Learning Server will cause no problems. In addition, you will benefit from the Python language.

  • 1/8Notice of Discontinuation of the Azure Classic portal

    We have added more functions on a continual basis to Azure portal ever since its launch. We are also gradually carrying out a service transition from Azure Classic portal to this portal. Azure portal is currently the core of all Azure services, providing a broad range of management experiences and functions, including the instrument panel for fixed resources, intelligent search to search for resources, Cloud Shell and Azure Resource Manager to achieve automation as well as a labelling function for resource management.

    We will shut down Azure Classic portal on January 8, 2018 to provide users of Azure portal with single and simplified experience. The existing users of Azure Classic portal do not need to perform any operations. We will provide you with all services and resources in the Azure portal.

December 2017

  • 12/31End of MP1 and MP2 Example Sales Promotion for the MySQL Database on Azure Service

    The 50% off MP1 and MP2 example promotion from MySQL Database on Azure service will come to an end immediately. Starting on January 1, 2018, the price of MP1 will go back to ¥7.64/hour (¥5684.16/month), while the price of MP2 will return to ¥12.02/hour (¥8942.88/month). For detailed information on pricing, please visit the Detailed Pricing of MySQL Database on Azure web page.

  • 12/19Azure Media Service’s “Real-time Channel Using Real-time Coding” Price Cut!

    Azure Media Services’ real-time channel provides audiences with a streaming content transmission using 2 types of nearly real-time methods: an unencoded real-time channel and a real-time channel using real-time coding. All real-time channel types will charge users based on the running-state time of channels instead of charging on data transferred and processed. With the help of this service, you can quickly deploy a real-time coding channel within a few seconds. All mainstream formats (HLS, MPEG - DASH and Smooth Streaming) and top DRM content protection systems (PlayReady, Widevine and Apple Fairplay) are supported. The price of a standard real-time coding channel is now up to 38% off, valid for settlement cycles starting on and after December 19, 2017.

    To learn more about this service and pricing, please visit the Media Services Functions and Detailed Price of Media Services web pages.

  • 12/18Azure IoT Suite Upgraded Remote Monitoring Solution Officially Released

    We are very pleased to announce today that the upgraded remote monitoring solution Azure IoT Suite has been officially released. This solution accelerator is offered in .NET and Java in an open-source format. It has a whole new interface. It is structured for scalability and size.

    The updated remote monitoring pre-configuration solution adopts the optimum functions in existing pre-configuration solutions, including a direct deployment into subscription function taking place within minutes, open-source availability and comprehensive functionality from equipment to business applications.

    For more details, please visit the Whole New Azure IoT Suite Blog, Internet of Things Solution Accelerator and Architecture of Remote Monitoring Pre-configuration Solutions web pages.

  • 12/01The MySQL Database on Azure Services example sales promotion of MP1 and MP2 will come to an end soon. The non-public preview plan for Azure Database for MySQL and PostgreSQL is going forward in an orderly manner

    The 50% off example promotion of MP1 and MP2 from MySQL Database on Azure service will come to an end on December 31, 2017. Starting January 1, 2018, the price of MP1 will go back to ¥7.64/hour (¥5684.16/month), while the price of MP2 will return to ¥12.02/hour (¥8942.88/month). For detailed information on pricing, please visit the Detailed Prices on MySQL Database on Azure web page.

    In addition, the Azure Database for MySQL and PostgreSQL service which is on global public preview will soon embark into China. The new-generation Azure open-source relationship database service possesses the following new features:

    • High availability service guarantee for 99.99% single examples (SLA)
    • Obtain corresponding IOPS performance scalability by changing the size of memory
    • It adopts the same architecture and service model as Azure services operated abroad by Microsoft. Although it cannot be directly connected with Microsoft’s foreign Azure data center, it is more beneficial for the client’s execution of the seamless transition of 21VIANET’s Azure and Microsoft’s foreign Azure.
    • PostgreSQL database service support

    We sincerely invite MP1 and MP2 users to participate in the free non-public preview. The service team can create free examples in the non-public preview of Azure Database for MySQL for the existing MP users’ database examples. They can be configured as general read-write main base or readable backup subordinate base examples for existing MP examples. During the non-public preview, the use of transited or newly created examples in services will be free. For specific details, please contact your sales representative and product manager from the product services team.

November 2017

  • 11/30New Azure Event Hubs Pricing Layer Officially Released

    We have provided Azure Event Hubs with a new pricing layer—dedicated event hubs. This pricing layer will introduce a fixed price based on an hourly rate. It is offered to all clients.

    Azure Event Hubs is an introductory service for super-large scale remote monitoring which can collect, convert and store millions of events. It is a fully hosted service, thus you can focus on capturing values from remote monitoring instead of data collection.

    Dedicated event hubs can provide single-tenant deployment for the most demanding clients. The major advantages of this service include:

    • Supports messages up to 1 MB
    • Guarantees that the capacity meets peak demand
    • Messages are kept 7 days without any extra charges
    • Single stream can support real-time pipeline and batch-based pipeline by using the Event Hubs capture function.

    These enhanced functions bring more value to price per capacity unit and enable you to pay for more flexible capacity use. For detailed information on pricing, please visit the Detailed Pricing of Event Hubs web page.

    If you have any questions, please click here to create online work orders, or call the 21VIANET technical support hotline at 400-089-0365 to receive Azure support.

  • 11/24Azure Host Disk P15 Now Officially Released

    Azure host disk is used in Azure virtual machines to realize the recommended disk memory products through permanent data storage. Host disk provides secure disk storage and simplified management as well as industry-leading durability and availability. The P15 disk is an advanced 256 GB host disk, providing a speed of 1,100 input/output operations (IOPS)/disk/second and a throughput of 125 MB/second. For more information about this service and its pricing, please visit the Storage Service Function and Host Disk Detailed Pricing web pages.

  • 11/02Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) Price Cut!

    Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) offers a discount of up to 17%. It provides enterprises with a faster, smoother client experience, helps you structure applications with high scalability and high response speed while reducing investment cost. For detailed pricing information, please visit the CDN Services Detailed Pricing web page.

  • 11/01Azure Analysis Services Officially Released

    Azure Analysis Services can convert complex data into operable insights. Azure Analysis Services is based on the verified analysis engines from Microsoft SQL Server 2016 analysis services. It can provide enterprise-level data modeling according to the size and advantages of the cloud. In addition, your team can capture more benefits from existing investments by using current technology, tools and data.

    You can use Azure analysis services to:

    • Simulate and structure any data of any size;
    • Quick start-up without any need for management infrastructure;
    • Provide a secure visit any time, anywhere;
    • View data by using your favorite data visualization tools;
    • Manage, deploy, test and deliver BI solutions with confidence.

    For detailed information on pricing, please visit the Azure Analysis Services Detailed Pricing web page.For more information on this service and how this service is deployed, please visit the Azure Analysis Services Functions and Azure Analysis Services - Adventure Works Tutorial Documents web pages.For more information about this release, please refer to Azure Analysis Services Official Release Blog.

October 2017

  • 10/31Cognitive Services: Computer Visual API and Face Recognition Officially Released

    The Computer Visual API and Face Recognition API have been officially launched in the Azure portal.The cognitive service is a set of APIs derived from dozens of years of research and development. Developers can explore high-quality visual, voice, linguistic and searching technology to structure intelligent applications through it.For more information about this product, please visit the Face Recognition API and Computer Visual API web pages; for detailed information on pricing, please visit the Cognitive Services Pricing web page; for more information about documentation information, please visit the Face API Documentation and Computer Visual Documentation web pages.

  • 10/20New Azure Virtual Machine Models Officially Released

    Azure has officially released DS13-2_v2, DS13-4_v2, DS14-4_v2 and DS14-8_v2 from the DS series of virtual machines. They limit the number of vCPU to half or a quarter of the original number of virtual machines while maintaining the same memory, storage and I/O bandwidth.Compared to earlier versions, the new series limits the number of vCPU and reduces the cost of software licensing, thus increasing cost effectiveness.For more details, please visit the New Models of Azure Virtual Machine Released — More Cost-effective Database Workload blog.

September 2017

  • 9/30Azure Storage Standard Managed Disk Promotion Ends

    The standard hosting disk uses storage media based on the hard disk drive (HDD).It best suits development or testing work that involves nonsensitive performance changes and other access work at a low frequency.The total cost of the standard hosting disk storage depends on the size and quantity of disks, quantity of transactions and transition volume of outbound data.Different standard disks provide the same IOPS and throughput.The marketing campaign will finish that very day. Azure will resume the normal price on October 1, 2017.To learn more about the services and pricing, please visit the Storage Disk Features page and the Hosting Disk Pricing page.

  • 9/8Data Science Virtual Machine Mirror Formally Launched

    The data science virtual machine (DSVM) is an Azure virtual machine mirror customized for data science. It integrates many popular data sciences, preliminary installation tools and preliminary configuration tools that can quickly build smart applications for advanced analysis on both Windows Servers and Linux servers.The DSVM is designed and configured to serve a broad range of scenarios.You can zoom in and out of the environment based on changes in project requirements and use your favorite languages to program for data sciences. Moreover, you can also install other customary systems based on your specific requirements. For more details, please visit this blog.

  • 9/7Azure Visual Studio 2017 Virtual Machine Mirror Formally Launched

    VS 2017 makes the development of Azure applications a seamless integration experience.It includes all functions required for Azure development and provides all features that allow the user to easily build, manage and deploy cloud applications on a large scale on the Azure platform.After launch of the Azure virtual machine mirror in China, the user now can easily build a development environment on Azure, and use the Visual Studio to build and test applications. For more details, please visit this blog.

  • 9/7Azure Launches New Performance Level of SQL Database and Additional Storage Preview Version

    S4, S6, S7, S9 and S12 are five new standard performance levels recently launched. At present, they remain at the previous status, and are very suitable for the CPU-intensive workloads that don’t require IO performance (provided by the higher level).

    The new additional storage allows the user to buy the additional storage without adding DTU or eDTU.Now, the user can buy S3-S12, P1-P6 and PRS1-PRS6 databases with a size of up to 1TB, a standard elastic pool with a size of up to 4TB, and a small eDTU advanced pool with a size of up to 1TB.

    For more information about new performance levels and additional storage, please visit the SQL Database Features page and the SQL Database Pricing Details page.

  • 9/7Azure Media Redactor Formally Launched

    The Azure Media Redactor is a powerful cloud video processing service that can automatically detect and dim human faces in the video and well suits public security, news media and other scenarios. Based on artificial intelligence technology developed by Microsoft, it can be used to increase the efficiency of manual video editing.For pricing details, please visit the Media Services Pricing Details page.To get more information about the service and how to deploy it, please visit the Azure Media Analysis to Perform Facial Modifications documentation and the Using Azure Media Analysis for Facial Modification Exercises documentation.

August 2017

  • 8/30Azure to End Standard Hosting Disk Service Marketing Campaign Soon

    The standard hosting disk uses storage media based on the hard disk drive (HDD).It best suits development or testing work that involves nonsensitive performance changes and other access work at a low frequency.The total cost of the standard hosting disk storage depends on the size and quantity of disks, quantity of transactions and transition volume of outbound data.Different standard disks provide the same IOPS and throughput.The current price is a promotional quotation. The recent marketing campaign will last until September 30, 2017, and we will resume the normal price on October 1, 2017.To learn more about the services and pricing, please visit the Storage Disk Features page and the Hosting Disk Pricing page.

  • 8/30HDInsight Kafka Preview Version Launched

    Now, a user can save the trouble of registration and directly deploy the Kafka cluster and hosting disk through the Azure portal. The service will provide strong scalability and reduce the cost with the expansion of the workload.With the pre-building system on the Azure resource manager template, the user can take only a few minutes to deploy a manageable, safe streaming channel (Kafka, Storm or Spark stream) integration experience.For pricing details, please visit the HDInsight Pricing Details page.To learn more information on the service and how to deploy it, please visit the HDInsight Features page and the Apache Kafka on HDInsight Introduction documentation page.

  • 8/30New-generation Azure VPN Gateway Formally Launched

    We recently introduced three all-new VPN gateways (VpnGw1, VpnGw2 and VpnGw3) for the Azure VPN gateway service to considerably improve the bandwidth and the service level agreement (SLA).

    1. The basic levels will stay unchanged under the current architecture.Standard and high-performance levels will be replaced with VpnGw1, VpnGw2 and VpnGw3.
    2. VPN gateways already deployed so far will not be automatically upgraded to the new level, but will maintain the current performance and pricing.Even so, we still suggest you migrate current gateways to a new level.Given no price change, the new gateways will enhance the performance by as much as 7 times.For pricing details, please visit the VPN Gateway Pricing Details page.To get more information on the service and how to deploy it, please visit the VPN Gateway Services page and VPN Gateway Documentation page.
  • 8/18 Azure Storage Disk Hosting Service Now Formally Launched

    Azure has formally launched the hosting disk service in the China region.The Azure hosting disk manages the storage account associated with the virtual machine disk to simplify the disk management of Azure IaaS virtual machines.You will only need to designate the type and size of the required disk, and Azure will create and manage the disk for you.You can use more than one hosting disk for every virtual machine.The hosting disk service provides two persistent storage options: advanced hosting disk and standard hosting disk.

    The disk storage provides high-security persistent disk options to support virtual machines.The advanced disk storage (SSD) is the most suitable for the I/O-intensive application, and low latency and high throughput are key features of the application.Now, in the China region, Azure has introduced two large-volume disks with the sizes of P40 (2TB) and P50 (4TB) for the hosting and non-hosting advanced disks.The advanced disk has increased the maximum IPOS to 7,500 and the bandwidth to 250MBps.

    As far as testing is concerned, the standard disk storage (HDD) helps you cut down the cost during rapid vertical scalability.In the China region, we also provide two new options, S40 (2TB) and S50 (4TB), for the standard hosting disk service.For the standard non-hosting disk, we can create a disk with a maximum size of 4.095TB.Standard disks of all sizes will provide an IOPS as high as 500 and a bandwidth of 60MBps.

    When you only have a small disk such as the operating system disk of a Linux virtual machine but need to obtain consistent disk performance, you can use these new disks of varying sizes to reduce the cost.The P4 advanced hosting disk provides an IOPS of up to 120 and a disk throughput of 25MBps, while these figures for the P6 advanced hosting disk are 240 and 50MBps respectively.

    For more details, please visit Migrate Azure VM to Azure Hosting Disks.To learn more about the services and pricing, please visit the Storage Disk Features page and the Hosting Disk Pricing page.

  • 8/18Azure Has Launched Disk Encryption Service in China

    Today, we are announcing Azure’s release of disk encryption service for Windows and Linux IaaS virtual machines in the China region.This signifies that Azure has released the disk encryption service for all users of Windows and Linux IaaS standard virtual machines (standard A, D, DS, F and other series), and customers now can employ encryption technologies based on industrial standards to protect their static operating systems and data disks.

    The Azure disk encryption function allows you to encrypt disks of Windows and Linux IaaS virtual machines.The Azure disk encryption technology employs the BitLocker function of Windows as the industrial standard and Linux’s DM-Crypt function to encrypt operating system and data disks and protect your data.Moreover, the technology also helps you to deliver on your organization’s commitment to security and compliance.This solution, integrated with the Azure Key Vault, helps you protect, control and manage disk encryption keys for key vault subscriptions. At the same time, the solution ensures all data in the disks of virtual machines realize static encryption in your Azure storage.

    For more details, please see the document Azure Disk Encryption Applicable to Windows and Linux IaaS VM page.

July 2017

  • 7/19Your Current DocumentDB Resource Has Become Part of the Azure Cosmos DB Resources on the Azure portal.

    As announced at the Microsoft Building conference in 2017, Azure Cosmos DB is the first multimodal database service spreading across the entire world, and provides universal SLAs that can be used to forge global applications.You have possibly noticed that your current DocumentDB resource has become part of Azure Cosmos DB resources on the Azure portal.Azure Cosmos DB provides the same SLA and pricing as those of DocumentDB, but offers more features and functions.Please note: As part of the recent evolution, the indicator and SKU names will be changed after August 1, 2017, and indicator GUID and prices will remain unchanged.To get more information on the recent evolution, please visit the blog Dear DocumentDB User, Welcome to Azure Cosmos DB!.For relevant product information, please visit the Cosmos DB Features page.For relevant pricing information, please visit the Cosmos DB Pricing Details page.

  • 7/11Azure Event Center has Formally Released the Capture Function

    The Azure Event Center is a data stream intake service that features real time, high scalability and full management. It can take in millions of events per second and generate a data stream with multiple applications.This will enable you to process and analyze mass data generated by connected equipment and applications.

    The capture function of the event center (namely, the event center documentation in the earlier public preview version) has been formally released.This function allows you to directly access data of the event center based on the time and size you define, and send these data to your destination, thereby specifically addressing your demand for long-term data saving and processing of downstream small batch data.The capture function of the event center offers the following benefits:

    • Enable simple settings;
    • Reduce the overall ownership cost;
    • Realize seamless integration with Azure Storage (which will soon add more data storage).
    • Realize quasi real-time batch analysis.

    For more information, please visit the blog Event Center Capture Formally Launched. For relevant product information, please visit the Event Center Features page.For relevant pricing information, please visit the Event Center Pricing Details page.

  • 7/11Azure Relay Hybrid Connection in Azure Server Bus Formally Launched

    The Azure Relay hybrid connection in the Azure server bus has been formally launched.For pricing details, please visit the Server Bus Pricing Details page.With the hybrid connection, you can use HTTPS, WebSockets and other open standards to realize safe connection with resources behind the local firewall and other cloud-based services or resources.To learn details about the service, please visit the Server Bus Functions page.

  • 7/11Azure Traffic Manager’s Rapid Failover Formally Released

    When using Azure Traffic Manager, you can employ the rapid failover service to realize more functions and optimize and customize failover behavior.The rapid failover function has now been formally released. You can choose to redirect users even faster to keep yourself away from abnormal terminals.In particular, you can now:

    1. Define a 10s interval for the flow manager to check the working status of the terminal (the interval is shorter than the present 30s);
    2. Configure the continuous failure counter (which falls between 1 and 10) before the terminal is marked as abnormal;
    3. Configure the timeout interval for every detection attempt (if the detection interval is 10s, the timeout interval will fall between 5s and 9s, and if the detection interval is 30s, the timeout interval will fall between 5s to 10s);
    4. Set the time-to-live (TTL) response.

    When the aforesaid configurable settings are used together, the flow manager can divert the flow from the degraded terminal at a faster speed than the standard settings by 90%.You can use the Azure portal, PowerShell, CLI, REST API or SDK to set the rapid failover.

    For more pricing information, please visit the Flow Manager Pricing Details page.To learn how to use the rapid failover function, please visit the Traffic Manager Terminal Monitoring and Failover documentation.

  • 7/7Azure DocumentDB Launches Corporate Preview Version of Minute Preliminary Configuration

    Now, you can employ the throughput configuration mode with a lower cost to supplement the second-based normal throughput (RU/s) per minute.For more pricing information, please visit the DocumentDB Pricing Details page.
